item.title: 美国证券交易委员会（SEC）新任主席要求员工删除有关工作活动的子弹式电子邮件
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）主席周四告诉员工，他们不再需要每周发送电子邮件，详细说明上周的工作成绩。【原文：The chairman of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission told staff Thursday they no longer need to send weekly emails detailing their work accomplishments from the previous week, according to two sources with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普与马斯克因税收法案的争执升级；特斯拉、道琼斯工业平均指数股价暴跌
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统周四抨击了埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk），称他对这位亿万富翁公开反对作为特朗普议程核心的全面减税和支出法案感到 "失望"。【原文：President Donald Trump lashed out on Thursday against Elon Musk, saying he was "disappointed" by the billionaire's public opposition to the sweeping tax-cut and spending bill that is at the heart of Trump's agenda.】

item.title: 特朗普建议终止马斯克的美国政府合同和补贴
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四暗示，他可能会终止美国政府给予埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）公司的合同和补贴，因为两人在税收和支出法案上的公开争执正在升级。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump suggested on Thursday that he may terminate U.S. government contracts and subsidies given to Elon Musk's companies, as the public feud between the two men escalates over a tax and spending bill.】

item.title: 钻井商和工会敦促美国参议员保护氢气信贷
item.description: 周四，一个由近 250 家公司、商业和劳工团体组成的联盟敦促美国共和党高层参议员在讨论唐纳德-特朗普总统的税收和支出法案时，保留对新兴氢燃料产业的信贷。【原文：A coalition of nearly 250 companies and business and labor groups on Thursday urged top U.S. Republican senators to preserve a credit for the emerging hydrogen fuel industry as they hash out President Donald Trump's tax and spending bill.】

item.title: 特朗普的预算法案将扼杀使家用太阳能成为主流的补贴政策
item.description: 据行业代表称，美国国会上月通过的共和党预算法案在最后一刻做出调整，将立即终止对太阳能租赁公司的补贴，而这些公司帮助房主买得起屋顶系统，这很可能导致安装速度大幅下降。【原文：A last-minute tweak to the Republican budget bill passed by Congress last month would immediately end subsidies for solar leasing companies that help make rooftop systems affordable to homeowners, likely leading to a massive drop in the pace of installations, according to industry representatives.】

item.title: 智利商业巨头庞塞退出持有锂矿商 SQM 股份的公司
item.description: 智利商业巨头胡里奥-庞塞（Julio Ponce）在周四的一份声明中表示，他将离开旗下的几家公司，同时这些公司宣布进行更广泛的重组，力求将各部门合并成更少的实体。【原文：Chilean business magnate Julio Ponce will leave several of his companies, he said in a statement on Thursday, while the firms announced a broader restructuring that seeks to merge units into fewer entities.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚农民誓言反对力拓锂矿项目，即使欧盟已将其列为战略项目
item.description: 塞尔维亚亚达尔地区的农民兹拉特科-科卡诺维奇（Zlatko Kokanovic）决心阻止力拓锂矿项目的开发，该项目本周被欧盟委员会确定为战略性项目，旨在减少矿产资源对中国的依赖。【原文：Zlatko Kokanovic, a farmer from Serbia's Jadar region, is determined to stop development of a Rio Tinto lithium project, identified this week as strategic by the European Commission as it aims to cut dependency on China for mineral resources.】

item.title: Robinhood 高管吹捧散户投资者实力，称隔夜交易是未来趋势
item.description: Robinhood 公司高管史蒂夫-奎克（Steve Quirk）周四称，散户投资者帮助市场在 4 月份暴跌后反弹，并补充说，年轻的自主交易者越来越多地在传统时间以外进行交易。【原文：Robinhood executive Steve Quirk on Thursday credited retail investors with helping the market rebound after a sharp plunge in April, adding that young self-directed traders were increasingly making trades outside traditional hours.】

item.title: 美联储哈克表示，在不确定性中应谨慎对待货币政策
item.description: 费城联储主席帕特里克-哈克（Patrick Harker）周四在作为央行行长的最后一次演讲中表示，目前经济前景尚未明朗，无法说明下一步货币政策的走向。【原文：In his final speech as a central banker, Philadelphia Federal Reserve President Patrick Harker said on Thursday the economic outlook is too unsettled right now to say what's next for monetary policy.】

item.title: 美联储施密德：对关税推动的价格上涨感到不安
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行行长杰夫-施密德（Jeff Schmid）周四表达了对关税可能重新引发通胀的担忧，称未来几个月物价上涨的压力可能会显现，但在更长的时间内还无法完全知晓。【原文：Kansas City Federal Reserve Bank President Jeff Schmid on Thursday expressed concern that tariffs could rekindle inflation, saying upward price pressure could be apparent in coming months but not fully known for much longer.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克有更多时间回应美国证券交易委员会就推特股份提起的诉讼
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）又给了埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）六周的时间来回应其民事诉讼，指控这位世界首富在 2022 年披露其在 Twitter（他后来收购并更名为 X 的社交媒体公司）的巨额股份时等得太久。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has given Elon Musk six more weeks to respond to its civil lawsuit accusing the world's richest person of waiting too long in 2022 to reveal his large stake in Twitter, the social media company he later bought and renamed X.】

item.title: 达美航空警告新关税可能迫使其停止购买外国制造的飞机
item.description: 达美航空公司警告说，对进口飞机和零部件征收新关税可能迫使该公司停止购买外国制造的飞机，从而影响数百万客户。【原文：Delta Air Lines warned new tariffs on imported airplanes and parts could force the airline to stop buying foreign-made planes impacting millions of customers.】

item.title: 安杜里尔在最新一次融资中获得 305 亿美元估值
item.description: 国防技术初创企业安杜里尔工业公司（Anduril Industries）周四表示，该公司在最新一轮融资中获得了 305 亿美元的估值，融资额达 25 亿美元。【原文：Defense technology startup Anduril Industries has clinched a valuation of $30.5 billion in its latest funding round where it raised $2.5 billion, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 巴西生物资源局坚信禽流感危机将很快结束
item.description: 巴西食品加工商巴西食品公司（BRF）相信，当地公司将能在几天内规避鸡肉贸易禁令，因为迄今为止，当地政府已经能够控制世界上最大的鸡肉出口国爆发的禽流感疫情。【原文：Brazilian food processor BRF is confident local companies will be able to circumvent chicken trade bans in a matter of days as local authorities have so far been able to control a bird flu outbreak in the world's largest chicken-exporting nation.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长认为 7 月暂停，但 9 月仍悬而未决
item.description: 四位消息人士告诉路透社，在周四举行的会议上，欧洲央行决策者中的明显多数都表示倾向于在下个月保持利率稳定，有几位甚至提出了暂停更长时间的理由。【原文：A clear majority of European Central Bank policymakers meeting on Thursday expressed a preference for holding interest rates steady next month and a few even made the case for an even longer pause, four sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 纽约证券交易所总裁马丁：尽管关税存在不确定性，但公共市场已为美国 IPO 的复兴做好准备
item.description: 洲际交易所（Intercontinental Exchange）旗下的纽约证券交易所（NYSE）总裁林恩-马丁（Lynn Martin）周四表示，尽管关税问题令人不安，但公共市场已为准备充分的公司做好了准备，因为波动的缓解为美国首次公开募股（IPO）活动的反弹创造了条件。【原文：Intercontinental Exchange-owned NYSE's President Lynn Martin said on Thursday that public markets were ready for well-prepared companies despite tariff unease as easing volatility was setting the stage for a rebound in U.S. IPO activity.】

item.title: 联合国机构称，随着人工智能的发展，科技巨头的间接排放量在三年内增加了 150
item.description: 联合国周四的一份报告称，亚马逊、微软、Alphabet 和 Meta 这四家以人工智能为重点的领先科技公司的间接碳排放量在 2020-2023 年间平均增加了 150%，因为它们不得不为能源需求大的数据中心使用更多电力。【原文：Indirect carbon emissions from the operations of four of the leading AI-focused tech companies, Amazon , Microsoft , Alphabet and Meta , rose on average by 150% from 2020-2023, as they had to use more power for energy-demanding data centres, a United Nations report said on Thursday.】

item.title: 欧盟农业负责人表示，南方共同市场协议可能在夏季前获得批准
item.description: 欧盟农业专员克里斯托夫-汉森（Christophe Hansen）周四告诉路透社，欧盟可能在夏季之前批准与南美集团南方共同市场（Mercosur）的贸易协议计划，但欧盟尚未确定批准日期。【原文：The European Union could approve its planned trade deal with South American bloc Mercosur before summer, but it has not yet fixed a date to do so, EU agriculture commissioner Christophe Hansen told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 精灵出来了Interactive Brokers 董事长称 24 小时交易势头强劲
item.description: Interactive Brokers 董事长托马斯-彼得菲（Thomas Peterffy）周四在 Piper Sandler 全球交易所与交易大会上表示，24 小时交易已变得更容易被接受，并称其为难以放回瓶中的精灵。【原文：Interactive Brokers Chairman Thomas Peterffy on Thursday said 24-hour trading has become more acceptable, calling it a genie that is hard to put back into the bottle, at the Piper Sandler Global Exchange & Trading Conference.】

item.title: 特朗普回击盟友马斯克，特斯拉股价下跌
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）是特斯拉公司的首席执行官，自称是唐纳德-特朗普总统的 "第一哥们"，最近几天他加大了对总统大规模税收立法的批评力度。投资者开始注意到这一点。【原文：Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla and self-proclaimed "First Buddy" of President Donald Trump, has stepped up criticism of the president's massive tax legislation in recent days. Investors are starting to notice.】

item.title: 特朗普攻击马斯克，公众对减税法案的不满升级
item.description: 特朗普还断言，马斯克对该法案的猛烈抨击是出于取消电动汽车消费者税收抵免的提议。【原文：Trump also asserted that Musk's blistering attacks on the bill were motivated by the proposed elimination of consumer tax credits for electric vehicles.】

item.title: 美联储主席库格勒：通胀面临上行风险，利率应保持不变
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）周四表示，只要关税继续威胁通胀，她就支持将美国短期借贷成本维持在当前的 "适度限制性 "水平。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler on Thursday said she supports keeping short-term U.S. borrowing costs at their current "moderately restrictive" level as long as tariffs continue to threaten to lift inflation.】

item.title: 对市场而言，欧洲央行降息的终点越来越近了
item.description: 由于欧洲央行认为自己有能力应对美国关税政策引发的全球经济不确定性，交易员们对欧洲央行暂停降息的信心与日俱增。【原文：Traders are increasingly confident the European Central Bank will pause its run of interest rate cuts now that the central bank sees itself as well-positioned to deal with global economic uncertainty fuelled by U.S. tariff policy.】

item.title: 稳定币公司 Circle 在纽交所首次公开募股时股价将翻一番，为 IPO 市场注入活力
item.description: 周四，Circle Internet 的股票在纽约证券交易所首次上市时将翻一番，有望成为第二大加密货币公司。【原文：Circle Internet's shares were set to double in their market debut on the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday, in what is expected to be the second-largest listing by a crypto company.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Blackstone 是 8 亿美元巴黎办公物业的竞标者之一
item.description: 一位熟悉此事的消息人士告诉路透社，Blackstone 是几家入围竞标者之一，他们将以 7 亿欧元（8 亿美元）的价格购买巴黎一座拥有逾百年历史的办公大楼，这将是欧洲大萧条后最大的办公楼销售活动之一。【原文：Blackstone is among several bidders shortlisted to buy a more than century-old office block in Paris with a price tag of 700 million euros ($800 million), a source familiar with the matter told Reuters, in what would be one of Europe's biggest post-pandemic office sales.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称欧盟首脑助手加入关税谈判团队以推动美国谈判
item.description: 三位熟悉谈判情况的消息人士称，欧盟已经更换了与特朗普政府进行贸易谈判的团队，引入了一位欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯德莱恩的亲密助手，以便更迅速地处理技术谈判中出现的政治问题。【原文：The European Union has changed its team locked in trade talks with the Trump administration, bringing in a close aide to European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen to deal more swiftly with political questions arising from the technical negotiations, three sources familiar with the talks said.】

item.title: 波音重建信任，航空公司老板看到喷气机质量提高
item.description: 航空公司老板们暂时对波音公司以适当质量交付喷气机的能力表示了更大的信心，这是为结束这家陷入困境的飞机制造商多年来声誉受损而迈出的一步。【原文：Airline bosses are tentatively voicing greater confidence in Boeing's ability to deliver jets at the right quality in a step towards ending years of reputational damage for the embattled planemaker.】

item.title: 部长称澳大利亚是 "安全可靠 "的关键矿产替代国
item.description: 澳大利亚贸易部长唐-法雷尔（Don Farrell）周四表示，面对人们对中国政府在这一领域的主导地位日益增长的担忧，澳大利亚可以为对工业至关重要的关键矿产提供安全的替代供应。【原文：Australia offers a secure alternative supply for critical minerals vital to industry, its trade minister Don Farrell said on Thursday, in the face of rising concerns about Beijing's dominance of the sector.】

item.title: 关税生效后美国铝溢价创历史新高
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对美国进口金属征收更高的关税后，周四美国消费者在实物市场上购买铝的溢价达到创纪录的每磅60美分或每公吨1,323美元。【原文：Premiums for consumers buying aluminium on the physical market in the United States hit a record 60 cents a lb or $1,323 a metric ton on Thursday after U.S. President Donald Trump imposed higher tariffs on U.S. imports of the metal.】

item.title: Citadel 首席执行官担心美国违约保险成本上升
item.description: Citadel 公司创始人兼首席执行官肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）周四表示，一种防止美国最终违约的金融工具的定价水平与一些欧洲国家接近，这是 "不可思议的"。【原文：Citadel's founder and CEO Ken Griffin said on Thursday it is "unfathomable" that a financial instrument to protect against an eventual U.S. default is being priced at levels close to some European countries.】
